Title: Product Manager, Release Engineering
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
Product Manager, Release Engineering
Wayfairs core platforms are increasingly driven by a cutting edge set of software systems that interact in complex ways to ensure that we are using them to their full potential. Business applications of these systems span many fields including the order lifecycle, supply chain, supplier partnerships, and more! These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for complex systems combined with configurability for rapid testing and exploration.
We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager to accelerate the development of our technology stack. This person will work with cross-functional teams, including engineers, science teams, and analysts, on platform capabilities needed for helping our teams deploy faster and with more confidence.
This person will be working with product and engineering partners to set a platform vision, form strong relationships with cross functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This person will translate the business and user needs into a pragmatic and iterative strategy and roadmap, along with providing specifications and user stories for the engineering teams. The product manager will serve as the subject matter expert, push for adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities.
 
What Youll Do:

Product Ownership: Serve as the subject matter expert and champion for release engineering, demonstrating a deep understanding of their technology, strengths, weaknesses, and market alternatives.
Strategic Planning: Partner with engineering leaders to develop and maintain a compelling product vision and roadmap, prioritizing feature requests based on business value and impact, and ensuring alignment with stakeholders.
End-to-End Delivery: Take full accountability for the successful delivery of platform enhancements and support, translating product outcomes into actionable engineering stories and tickets.
Adoption and Advocacy: Proactively market your products internally, measuring adoption, addressing gaps, and ensuring all potential users understand the value proposition.
Technical Acumen: Gain a deep understanding of the technologies underpinning your products, enabling you to influence technical pivots when necessary and architect high-level system plans.
Stakeholder Communication: Maintain open and transparent communication with stakeholders, providing regular updates on product progress and ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

Product Management Experience: 2+ years of experience in product development, preferably with software platforms, demonstrating a proven track record of delivering successful products.
Technical Foundation: 1+ years of foundational understanding of software technologies, ideally with experience in accelerating deployment patterns.
Standards Development: Experience in developing or influencing standards related to access management, asset provisioning, and governance processes.
Data Analysis Skills: Proficiency in SQL, enabling you to extract ad hoc data for analysis and decision-making.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication abilities, with a demonstrated aptitude for explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Customer Focus: A passion for creating amazing, customer-centric products, with a focus on measuring their effectiveness and usability through clear KPIs.
Collaboration and Prioritization: Ability to effectively collaborate across multiple stakeholder groups, juggle large initiatives, and prioritize work based on impact.
Agile Experience: Experience working with engineering teams in an agile environment, including sprint planning, stand-ups, and backlog management.
Cloud Familiarity: Familiarity with Google Cloud and its data offerings is a plus.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair is seeking a senior product leader to shape and scale our global payments infrastructure and integrations. These platforms are critical for processing Wayfairs billions of dollars in annual global revenue and helping Wayfairs millions of customers shop confidently by making transactions with Wayfair secure, seamless, and convenient. 
You will partner with Wayfairs Financing, Loyalty, Payments, Fraud, and Gift Card business teams to drive product strategy, roadmaps, and delivery across a broad set of payment journeys. The Purchase technology teams also design, build, and evolve surrounding customer experiences including Cart, Checkout, Financing education & approval, Loyalty sign-up and renewals, across all web and native app platforms.
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.
Our customer technology team is responsible for building and growing the native apps and websites customers use to shop our catalog. We leverage technology to make shopping for millions of products feel simple and personal. 
We are looking for an experienced product manager to own product strategy, vision, and execution of the customer tech data engineering workstream. This team is responsible for the development and optimization of our enterprise-scale data infrastructure that fuels personalization, customer insights, and business performance across Wayfair. Youll lead a cross-functional team partnering closely with engineering, data science, and business stakeholders to build and evolve our core data pipelines, platforms, and tools to enable opportunities and insights across our e-commerce experience. Youll be part of an exceptionally talented Product Management and Technology community at a Fortune 500 company.
What Youll Do:

Drive product discovery, strategy, and roadmap for our customer data engineering ecosystem
Lead cross-functional technology team to define data requirements and ensure seamless integration of data across systems and platforms
Design and own the delivery of scalable ETL pipelines and multi-layered data platforms
Evangelize best practices for data ownership & stewardship, shaping our approach to a scalable and high quality platform for customer data.
Partner with data scientists, analysts, and machine learning scientists across multiple stakeholder groups to enable use cases in personalization, machine learning, and business intelligence

What youll Need:

Total 10+ years experience and 3+ years experience in software product management with direct experience with data platforms or data engineering products
An ownership mentality. You proactively work to improve your product, its reliability, and plans for its future state. You propose adjustments to priorities as needed, and take responsibility for outcomes, celebrating team wins, and surfacing learning moments.
Good judgment. You manage risk, know when to pivot, can assess multiple paths forward, and use data to inform and advocate for the right next steps.
Technical acumen. You can understand intended customer and business outcomes and translate them into backend data, data service, and platform solutions that manage for scalability. You have a proven track record of sustaining and maintaining a high bar for your platform space.
Collaborative approach & excellent communication skills. You have experience working with multiple disciplinesengineering, design, analytics and business partnersand ability to accelerate progress toward shared goals and bring others along.

Title: Senior Associate, Training & Onboarding
RoleDescription:
Training & Onboarding Senior Associate, Global Sales
As a Training & Onboarding Senior Associate for Wayfairs Global Sales team, youll play a critical role in accelerating new hire success and enabling continuous skill development across our sales organization. You will facilitate engaging, high-impact learning experiences and serve as a trusted partner to sales leadership, ensuring our teams are equipped with the knowledge, skills, and tools to thrive.
What Youll Do

Facilitate dynamic training programs for adult learnersincluding new hire onboarding, upskilling/cross-skilling sessions, continuing education, and process change rolloutsacross B2B and B2C sales teams.
Deliver training through multiple modalities (virtual (primarily), in-person (occasionally), synchronous/asynchronous), utilizing materials and tools developed by the Learning Experience Design team.
Coach during nesting and ramp periods, supporting new hires as they apply learning on the job, identifying skill gaps, and offering targeted follow-up.
Monitor and measure learner success, using predefined metrics and checklists to track performance for a minimum of the nesting period and up to 60 days post-training.

Track and report on metrics such as time to productivity, training satisfaction, learner engagement, and knowledge retention.

Provide detailed learner insights to sales leaders, including strengths, development opportunities, and tailored coaching recommendations.
Partner cross-functionally with Learning Experience Designers, SMEs, and sales stakeholders to ensure training content is accurate, relevant, and timely.
Continuously improve training programs by logging trends, learner feedback, and common challenges; recommend updates to improve impact and learner retention.
Manage training logistics and operations, including scheduling, communication, attendance tracking, and material preparation.
Reinforce key concepts through small group coaching, shadow sessions, and performance observations.
Stay current on learning trends in sales enablement, adult learning, and virtual facilitation to enhance delivery and learner engagement.
Assist with light content design or updates in partnership with Learning Experience Designersthis may include refining facilitation decks, updating job aids, or contributing feedback to improve learner materials.
Foster a culture of growth, inclusion, and positivity, modeling adaptability, collaboration, and customer-centric thinking.

Champion an inclusive learning environment where all employees feel represented, respected, and supported.

Travel as needed for in-person training, facilitation, workshops, and stakeholder engagement.

What Youll Bring

24 years of experience in training, onboarding, sales enablement, or adult learning (sales or contact center environment preferred)
Strong facilitation and presentation skills with experience leading adult learners across various levels and roles
Confidence navigating ambiguity, adapting quickly to change, and managing multiple programs simultaneously
A learner-first mindset with a bias for action and continuous improvement
Excellent communication, collaboration, and organization skills
Comfort working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Familiarity with virtual facilitation platforms (e.g., Google Meet, Slack) and LMS tools

Nice-to-Haves

Experience supporting both B2C and B2B sales teams
Experience in performance coaching or onboarding program design
Familiarity with content authoring tools (e.g., Articulate, Rise, or similar)
Experience designing or editing learning content, such as slide decks, facilitator guides, or learner-facing materials

Title: Senior Analyst, People Analytics- Technology
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is currently seeking a Senior People Analyst to lead our people analytics strategy for the Technology organization.  In this role, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our talent strategy and enhancing the employee experience through data-driven insights. You will leverage your analytical expertise to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and empower leaders to make informed decisions across the talent lifecycle.
The ideal candidate will have an affinity for solving business problems through innovative approaches - quantitative and qualitative - and will be able to keep an eye on the bigger picture, looking around corners, while diving deep into our data sets and processes. This role requires regular interaction with senior stakeholders so communication of our results is key.
What Youll Do

Own the analytics roadmap for processes, insights (business reviews and reporting) and data products such as dashboards (e.g. Visier, Looker) for the Technology organization.
Proactively identify opportunities for insight generation and scope new projects that elevate the People Analytics roadmap in alignment with Tech strategy.
Design and refine measurement frameworks that integrate qualitative and quantitative data to assess organizational health and the impact of emerging technologies like GenAI.
Lead projects spanning the full talent lifecycle, including annual voice, attrition, and team health reporting, ensuring analyses drive action through hiring, development, and retention in partnership with Talent Business Partners and Talent central teams.
Automate recurring people analytics projects to deliver insight more regularly and scalably to leaders and stakeholders.
Turn data into actionable insights that tell a cohesive story and deliver business recommendations that resonate with executive stakeholders (Director+).
Build key stakeholder relationships - create awareness around the possibilities of what analytics can help our partners measure and achieve.
Partner closely with a team of people analysts, business intelligence analysts, and data engineers to evolve our talent data model and design consumable, high-impact dashboards and visualizations.
Drive the development and implementation of new people analytics processes and data products (e.g., metadata tagging), to enhance data accessibility and insight generation.
Communicate clearly and effectively across teams, levels, and leadership.
Manage, mentor and onboard junior employees within the team to build leadership skill set.
Respect the sensitivity, privacy, and confidentiality of candidate and employee data by adhering to best practices for data governance.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in quantitative field like Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, or Statistics; masters degree in any of the preceding or related fields a plus
2+ years experience in analytical role in a fast-paced environment (in addition to any graduate education)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to build high fidelity, data-driven narratives (e.g. written, slides, etc.) using GenAI tools (e.g. Gemini, ChatGPT) for senior stakeholders.  
Extensive experience using SQL and another programming language (Python or R) to write scalable code;
Experience with spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets) and BI/data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Visier) preferred
Proven ability to solve complex business problems through data analysis, with a strong focus on aligning insights to strategic priorities and communicating them effectively. 
Integrity and honesty, and, above all, a respect for complete confidentiality
Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks, coordinate with stakeholders, and drive timely resolution through structured problem-solving 
Experience working with or in software development, applied research, product, and/or data science teams is a plus

Senior Creative Strategist  Performance Creative
This is a remote work position with travel expected for quarterly in-person meetings and conferences. The position can also be a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ (Tuesday - Thursday in office, Monday/Friday remote).
Wayfairs Performance Creative team is seeking a data-driven Senior Creative Strategist to lead the development of innovative, insight-led ad creative across paid social and digital channels. This is a key role at the intersection of storytelling, design, and data, focused on producing high-performing creative that drives measurable impact across the funnel on platforms like Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and beyond.
As part of a fast-paced, cross-functional team, youll collaborate with performance marketers, designers, editors, and data analysts to translate business goals into compelling customer-facing creative. You will own end-to-end campaign ideationfrom research and messaging strategy to creative testing and optimizationensuring every asset we launch upholds brand integrity, follows channel best practices, and is built to convert.
This role is ideal for a creative strategist with 5+ years of experience in performance-driven environments who thrives on balancing storytelling with experimentation, and can bring structure and strategic clarity to a high-volume creative pipeline.
What You'll Do:

Own the Creative Strategy for Paid Campaigns: Lead strategy for ad creative across key paid channels including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, Paid Search, and programmatic. Develop insight-driven concepts tailored to platform behavior, audience mindset, and performance goals.
Drive End-to-End Campaign Development: Develop compelling creative concepts, messaging frameworks, and testing roadmaps grounded in insights. Collaborate with SEO and Consumer Insights teams to ensure strategies are data-informed, and partner with designers and producers to bring ideas to lifefrom initial edits to final delivery.
Craft and Manage UGC Briefs: Own the creation of strategic creative briefs for user-generated content (UGC) partners, ensuring content is aligned to campaign objectives, performance goals, and channel best practices.
Translate Insights into Impact: Analyze performance data and audience behavior to inform testing priorities and future creative iterations. Develop hypotheses, build testing matrices, and partner with performance marketers to continually optimize and unlock incremental performance gains.
Track and Share Creative Learnings: Monitor creative performance trends and consolidate learnings to inform future strategy. Proactively share insights and recommendations with the broader creative and marketing teams to promote a culture of continuous learning and data-driven iteration.
Cross-Functional Leadership: Act as a creative point of contact for the Marketing team, ensuring strategic alignment across creative and media plans. Present ideas and creative rationale to stakeholders with confidence and clarity.
Support Seasonal Campaign Launches: Collaborate with the Go-To-Market (GTM) team to influence and direct seasonal campaign creative, ensuring assets are optimized for paid channels and grounded in SEO insights while identifying content gaps. 
Mentor and Inspire: Help guide designers by providing actionable feedback, moodboards, and strategic direction. Champion experimentation, iteration, and scrappy production methods to maximize learning velocity.
Leverage & Repurpose Assets: Strategically utilize existing lifestyle, studio, 3D, and UGC video and static assets to scale output efficiently across channels while maintaining creative effectiveness.

What You'll Need:

5+ years of experience concepting, writing, and producing direct response ads in a fast-paced and high volume environment, such as a digital marketing agency or an in-house growth team, ideally in e-commerce or DTC.
1+ years of experience working directly with paid media (Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, etc.) as a media buyer or equivalent role, with a clear understanding of how creative impacts performance.
Experience with Facebook Ads Manager, creative testing tools, and performance reporting dashboards
A proven ability to develop and scale direct response creative that drives measurable results.
Deep understanding of platform-specific creative best practices, including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and other emerging formats.
Strong creative instincts with a focus on clarity, conversion, and audience empathy.
Experience working with graphic designers, video editors, content creators, and production teams to ship high volumes of content.
Familiarity with testing methodologies, performance metrics, and using data to guide creative iterations.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects across different stakeholders and timelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to guide copywriters on scripts, headlines, and performance-oriented copy.
Comfort working in a hybrid, collaborative environment that values speed, curiosity, and creativity.

Portfolio or examples of past campaigns, especially those tied to performance metrics, are highly encouraged.

Experience with creative automation platforms or modular content systems for the consistent production of a high volume of creative assets
Prior experience in retail, home, or lifestyle categories
Interest and knowledge of cutting-edge technology such as AI-generated content and VO
Familiarity with creative tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus for providing clear design feedback, but this is not a design role.

Wayfair is THE destination for all things home: helping everyone, anywhere create their feeling of home. Leverage BI tooling to develop easily digestible and user friendly data visualizations, reporting, and data solutions, and train our partners on relevant applications to promote long term adoption of these products. 
Ensure our merchandising, operations, marketing, and promotions partners have the tools, data, and reporting they need to make decisions, especially those around assortment creation, promotions, branding, and marketing.

Grow and develop the team. Manage 2-3 direct reports and foster development of their technical and professional skillset.

Bachelors Degree in analytics, statistics, economics, finance, or a related field
5+ years of experience in a quantitative or analytical role
Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings
Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills: ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Expertise in SQL, in addition to other programming languages.
Demonstrated track record of developing advanced reporting in Google DataStudio, PowerBI or similar platforms.

Title: Wayfair Stores, Recruiter
RoleDescription:
The role is based out of our Wilmette,IL Wayfair store and is fully onsite Monday through Friday. This role requires some flexibility to work occasional weekends or in-store events
The salary range for this position is $60,800-69,588/yr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
At Wayfair, we believe great people build great teams, and that starts with you. As our Retail Recruiter, you'll be the engine behind our store's talent strategy, ensuring were hiring the right people, at the right time, for the right roles. Youll build strong partnerships with store leaders, understand the unique needs of each department, and deliver a candidate experience that reflects our brand: welcoming, helpful, and a little playful.
This role is equal parts relationship-builder, problem-solver, and brand ambassador. Youll manage everything from traditional and creative sourcing, to screening candidates and offer letters, to candidate onboarding details and process changes. All of this, while constantly staying two steps ahead of the hiring curve. If you thrive in fast-paced and changing environments, love connecting people to purpose, and take pride in creating seamless hiring experiences, this role could be your professional home.What Youll Do:

 Own Onsite Recruitment: You will primarily serve as the face of Talent Acquisition in the store, working onsite five days a week to build strong, in-person relationships with stakeholders, hiring managers, and future team members.
 Understand the Business Inside & Out: Develop a deep understanding of each hiring manager and department, including Logistics, Visual, Sales, Design, Retail Engagement, and Asset Protection, to deliver qualified talent aligning with both role requirements and team culture.
 Source Strategically & Creatively: Leverage tools like Avature, GEM, Visier, and Greenhouse along with creative, boots-on-the-ground sourcing efforts. You will use this to build strong pipelines, generate quality applicant flow, and attract talent in both expected and unexpected places.
 Own Job Postings and ATS Accuracy: Create, update, and maintain job postings with precision while ensuring the applicant tracking system remains accurate, organized, and optimized for hiring success.
 Deliver Exceptional Hiring Experiences: Champion clean, consistent, and positive candidate and hiring experiences that reflect Wayfairs values from start to finish.
 Coordinate Recruiting Events: Support community hiring initiatives, job fairs, store promotional events, and external partnerships that generate buzz and attract great talent.
 Act as a Recruiting Subject Matter Expert: Provide leadership guidance on hiring strategy, process improvements, and talent insights, while escalating issues thoughtfully and offering proactive solutions.
 Balance Priorities with Precision: Manage competing demands across multiple roles and departments through smart prioritization, clear communication, and confident decision-making, understanding your return on investment.
 Drive Stakeholder Alignment: Build trust quickly, manage feedback, interview loops, and align cross-functional partners toward shared hiring goals, while surfacing key insights and trends to your TA Leadership Team.
 Adapt and Iterate: Embrace feedback, adjust to change, and continuously improve the hiring process by solving challenges and bringing forward fresh ideas.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Stakeholder Relations: You build trust quickly and can partner confidently with hiring managers across departments to deeply understand who and what they need on their teams.
 Sourcing Creativity: You bring fresh ideas to the top of the funnel and are comfortable with boots-on-the-ground recruiting, as well as  using tools like Indeed, GEM, and social platforms to spark applicant flow and uncover hidden talent.
 Recruiting Experience: You have 1+ years of experience in a high-volume corporate or agency recruiting environment and are eager to continue growing your TA expertise.
 Detail Discipline: You are highly organized while moving fast, keep systems clean, follow through flawlessly, and know how to juggle shifting priorities with ease while remaining in accordance with deadlines in a high-volume environment.
 Clear and Confident Communication: You communicate with clarity and professionalism across varying audiences that may require different approaches or messaging.
 Growth-Ready Mindset: Youre adaptable, take feedback in stride, and bring a proactive, can-do attitude to change and new challenges.
 In-Person Energy: This is a fully on-site role, and you shine in face-to-face environments where building in-person relationships makes a lasting impact.
 Talent-Spotting Everywhere: You believe great talent is all around us and treat every interaction as a potential recruiting opportunity, whether its during a shift, a store visit, or out in the community.
 AI-Savvy Mindset: You know how to leverage AI-powered tools and resources to boost your own productivity, enhance team efficiency, and drive better, faster results (without losing the human touch). While not a requirement, this is a huge plus in our space.
 Educational Foundation: A bachelors degree is preferred, but what matters most is your hunger to learn and grow.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.

 And So Much More: *Weve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

Who We Are
In the Catalog Health team, we strive for a healthy catalog to instill customer trust by ensuring only products that meet Wayfair standards are findable on site in the right way at the right time, supplied by right-fit-for-Wayfair partners that operate within our Code of Conduct expectations. 
How is this opportunity unique?
On the Global Findability team, you will have a unique opportunity to serve as the connective tissue that works to holistically increase the health of the entire catalog. You will help develop the strategy of the platform that governs product offering, working cross functionally to create feedback loops enabling quick resolution for suppliers looking to re-list affected products. Strong communication, and being able to distill complex instructions or context up & down the chain is key. As a leader in the findability operations space, we need to have a 360 degree view of key product requirements across the org, and understand the levers to pull to resolve product level or large scale issues effectively.

Title: Manager, Commercial Business Analytics
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Data Engineer III, Growth & Discovery
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
About the Role: 
As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Engineering team with this role being inherently multi-functional, and the ideal candidate will work with Data Scientist, Analysts, Application teams across the company, as well as all other Data Engineering squads at Wayfair. We are looking for someone with a love for data, understanding requirements clearly and the ability to iterate quickly. Successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication and a belief that data-driven processes lead to phenomenal products. 
 
What you'll do: 

Build and launch data pipelines, and data products focussed on SMART Org. 
Helping teams push the boundaries of insights, creating new product features using data, and powering machine learning models.
Build cross-functional relationships to understand data needs, build key metrics and standardize their usage across the organization. 
Utilize current and leading edge technologies in software engineering, big data, streaming, and cloud infrastructure 

 
What You'll Need: 

6+ years relevant work experience in the Data Engineering field with web scale data sets. 
Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science or related technical subject area or equivalent combination of education
Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development and data lake architecture.
Data Warehousing Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto, Airflow etc.).
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Scala, etc)
Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing and query performance tuning skills of large data sets.
Industry experience as a Big Data Engineer and working along cross functional teams such as Software Engineering, Analytics, Data Science with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
Strong business acumen. Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using GCP technologies  Big Query, Dataproc, GCS, Cloud Composer, Dataflow or related big data technologies in other cloud platforms like AWS, Azure etc. 
Be a team player and introduce/follow the best practices on the data engineering space.
Ability to effectively communicate (both written and verbally) technical information and the results of engineering design at all levels of the organization.

 
Good to have : 

Understanding of NoSQL Database exposure and Pub-Sub architecture setup.
Familiarity with Bl tools like Looker, Tableau, AtScale, PowerBI, or any similar tools.
